job_title: WIC Nutrition Assistant in Hayward, CA
pros: Great HR support. TVHC as a whole aims to provide employee perks as much as possible.
cons: Work life will greatly depend on how your supervisor is. There were some really good ones and some really bad ones at TVHC.

pros: Rewarding mission of supporting children and their families.
cons: High caseload , poor management, and low pay

review_title: Great place to start if you need experience
pros: I do like that they have pretty good health insurance (medical, restricted dental and vision, and even pet!). Most of the sites have great flexibility, and the clinics will usually try to find a way to accommodate employees' schedules whenever possible. A lot of the employees at the lower level (MAs/reception) are pretty good team players and will help out coworkers at other sites if they have questions or need info. They provide some time off for continuing education, so a lot of employees here will end up transferring/rising to higher positions within the clinics. I do get some satisfaction knowing that, between different departments (medical/dental/eligibility [insurance], etc), we are helping members of the community be safe, healthy, and insured in the future. :)
cons: We are definitely underpaid and we don't get significant raises. We get a few-cent "raise" every few years; we do get cost-of-living pay adjustments, but I wouldn't consider that a raise. A lot of the sites work a bit differently, and our call center department, which schedules a good chunk of all appointments, tends to schedule appointments incorrectly - they're just not on top of updated scheduling guidelines, which created extra work for the different sites. I say this as someone who also helped in that department - we were given information 2-3 weeks after the main sites had already implemented changes. A lot of our pediatric providers are wonderful, but most adult medicine providers are so-so, and a couple of them are almost impossible to work with. Favoritism is definitely an issue - you'll sometimes see someone getting promoted when they haven't shown any drive or reason to get promoted.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Hayward, CA
pros:
-Staff are supportive and helpful
-Growth opportunities
-Making a difference in the community or to staff
cons: Wearing multiple hats but I think overall it is a great experience instead of focusing on one thing alone

pros: Easy to obtain clinical hours towards licensure. Supportive staff at health clinic.
cons: Medi-cal billing, firm deadlines, and not much support from clinical staff to reinforce mental health services within school environment. In addition, was placed in a primarily in a Spanish speaking school making access to services challenging when my primarily language is English.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Hayward, CA
pros: Great place to start as an MA. Great work environment. Staff is very friendly and great to work with. They cross train you in Pediatrics, OB/GYN and Family Medicine which is great since you develop useful skills in all departments.
cons: Lacks communication between administrative staff and salary is not great for all the work you do.

pros: Great starting place to gain experience
cons: No CMA certificate pay raise

pros:
Serving the members of the community that need help the most is a very rewarding experience I have never had at previous jobs. This is also the first job I've ever had where I actually enjoy going to work and don't have anxiety on Sunday nights thinking about everything that I have to do. 

The leadership at TVHC is incredible, they let you take ownership of your work, give you space to try new ideas and are extremely knowledgable. Also, the TVHC executive team is what diversity and inclusion should look like at all organizations.

All employees get free health, dental, and vision and have ZERO out of pocket expenses!
cons:
Since it is a non-profit you do end up wearing multiple hats and may find yourself helping out other departments when if needed.

Parking can be a challenge at some of the sites.

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Hayward, CA
pros: Managers are confident and supportive of my clinical work and do not micromanage in that regard. Higher salary than other Behavioral Health positions, and excellent benefits.
cons: Administration and management expects staff to meet billing quotas for clinical work but also requires many non-billable tasks as part of job description, creating high-pressure environment when not working clinically. An absurd amount of redundant and irrelevant administrative work, compared to other agencies. Behavioral Health is low on the totem pole of programs.

job_title: Senior Director of IT in Hayward, CA
pros: I have a great team. Everyone is welling to help and eager to learn new things.  There are many improvements to be made, but we have a plan. The important thing is, everyone here has an open mind, and the willingness to go with my plan. We have great time working together and collaborating with other departments.
cons: Number one priority is to improve communication. However, many FQHC are facing similar issue.

review_title: Great organization to start a career in healthcare
pros: Flexible work schedule, friendly staff, great health insurance for staff. Ability to think outside the box and introduce new ideas.
cons: Little to no professional growth for management. No standardization .Change happens periodically which stresses front line staff.  Pension plan can be better. Staff hold multiple roles which can be difficult to manage.

pros: They were very good to their patients, for the most part
cons: VERY unprofessional staff of medical assistants,, a lot of bickering between staff, an administrative secretary who threw her weight around like she owned the place and got away with it. This was before the tenure of David Vliet.

pros: Innovative and collaborative environment. Great benefits - no cost medical plan option. Leadership and staff care deeply about serving our community. Great co-workers. Organization is pivoting quickly to meet the changing landscape of COVID 19. Every day is different which allows growth and development. Excited to see where our new CEO will take us. She was promoted from within so she knows us well!
cons: Non-profit so wages are lower than private sector.

pros: Great team of people to work with, they are focused on their mission and really care.  The organization has come a long way over the years and has made a lot of improvements.  They support their employees educational goals with scholarships and tuition reimbursement.
cons: Recruitment and retention is a challenge in today's environment.  They are working on some programs to address and their benefits and pay.

pros: Inspiring mission, working alongside very passionate colleagues, great benefit package, opportunities to develop in your career, they do things to show employee appreciation, people have been here for years.
cons: You tend to wear multiple hats in non-profits, so it can be stressful at times but it's rewarding work.

review_title: A nice place to begin a career
